intro: Boldoa lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf boldoa, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its aromatic foliage and delicate blooms make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Boldoa lanceolata prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in temperate climates.
